candidates.title_2: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Transmission rate increases with infected density. Recovery rate decreases infection duration. When transmission exceeds recovery (R0>1), epidemic spreads exponentially. Vaccination reduces susceptible population shifting R0 below 1. Spatial heterogeneity creates local pockets where R0 varies.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled multi-timescale dynamics with threshold-based control transition. Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). Natural control sufficient above threshold; below threshold requires engineered intervention to navigate both timescales simultaneously.

candidates.title_1: Unleashing the Potential of Differential Evolution through Individual-Level Strategy Diversity
candidates.title_2: Modeling tumor progression in heterogeneous microenvironments: A cellular automata approach
candidates.mechanism_1: Assigning mutation and crossover strategies independently to each individual at initialization and keeping them fixed creates persistent behavioral heterogeneity. Static individual-level diversity (no adaptation) cultivates search effectiveness especially with large populations. Communication-free construction enables intrinsic concurrency and efficient parallel execution.
candidates.mechanism_2: Environmental state dominates progression dynamics over intrinsic mutation rates in spatially structured systems: supportive environments amplify weak growth signals into invasive spread, while inhibitory environments suppress even high-mutation populations.

candidates.title_1: ROMAN: Reward-Orchestrated Multi-Head Attention Network for Autonomous Driving System Testing
candidates.title_2: Higher-order adaptive behaviors outperform pairwise strategies in mitigating contagion dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Reward-orchestrated multi-head attention for high-risk scenario generation. Multiple attention heads each explore different dimension of scenario space (traffic law compliance, environmental complexity, safety risk), with reward function orchestrating attention allocation to prioritize generation of rare critical edge cases that expose system vulnerabilities rather than common benign scenarios.
candidates.mechanism_2: Higher-order information creates heterogeneous risk perception targeting structural hubs and high-participation nodes, preventing contagion exploitation of these critical paths at lower social cost than uniform interventions.

candidates.title_1: Imperfect Turing Patterns: Diffusiophoretic Assembly of Hard Spheres via Reaction-Diffusion Instabilities
candidates.title_2: Understanding the temperature response of biological systems: Part II -- Network-level mechanisms and emergent dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Multi-scale pattern formation via coupled reaction-diffusion and particle assembly. Classical Turing mechanism (single length scale from reaction-diffusion balance) coupled to finite-size particle assembly driven by background chemical gradient (diffusiophoresis) plus particle-particle interactions. Introduces additional control parameters (particle size, Péclet number, interaction strength) creating imperfections, grain textures, and multi-scale structures.
candidates.mechanism_2: Individual Arrhenius-like temperature dependence at reaction level transforms into non-Arrhenius scaling, thermal limits, and temperature compensation at network level. Coupled biochemical reactions with temperature-modulated kinetics exhibit emergent system-level temperature response curves that differ from component behaviors. Network coupling creates effective nonlinearities and collective constraints, transforming simple exponential dependencies into complex organism-level thermal responses.

candidates.title_1: Thermodynamic Origin of Degree-Day Scaling in Phase-Change Systems
candidates.title_2: Crossing the Functional Desert: Cascade-Driven Assembly and Feasibility Transitions in Early Life
candidates.mechanism_1: Phase transitions impose topological constraints that mask energetic fluctuations. Introducing a latent temperature (counterfactual unconstrained trajectory) resolves information loss. Energy conservation enforces duality: total latent heat dissipated equals accumulated exceedance of latent temperature above melting point. This duality is mathematically equivalent to Wasserstein-1 distance (optimal transport) between latent and observed trajectories, with phase change emerging as transport that projects continuous energy variability onto constrained thermodynamic boundaries.
candidates.mechanism_2: Functional organization transitions at critical connectivity: below threshold, cascades die locally creating a functional desert (sparse, transient responses); near percolation threshold, system-spanning cascades emerge enabling discriminative responses. Connectivity-driven transition introduces coherence timescales and weak path-dependence into otherwise memoryless exploration. Network dynamics alone soften combinatorial feasibility barriers without requiring specific biochemistry.

candidates.title_1: Coarse-graining and stochastic oscillations in a phenomenological model of cell-size homeostasis
candidates.title_2: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Cell size feedback operates through size deviations (difference between absolute size and cell-cycle progression). Feedback from size to growth rate and cycle timing creates coupled dynamics. In linear regime, dynamics reduce to stochastically forced harmonic oscillator. Cell-cycle timing and intrinsic fluctuations jointly shape size control strategy. Mechanistic feedback structure may differ from apparent coarse-grained correlations due to noise integration.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled multi-timescale dynamics with threshold-based control transition. Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). Natural control sufficient above threshold; below threshold requires engineered intervention to navigate both timescales simultaneously.

candidates.title_1: Normative Equivalence in Human-AI Cooperation: Behaviour, Not Identity, Drives Cooperation in Mixed-Agent Groups
candidates.title_2: Low-Dimensional Interaction Spaces Impose Geometric Constraints On Collective Organization
candidates.mechanism_1: Reciprocal group dynamics and behavioral inertia drive cooperation levels in groups. Cooperation depends on observed group behavior patterns rather than the identity of participants. These normative mechanisms operate identically regardless of agent type, creating stable cooperation patterns through behavioral feedback.
candidates.mechanism_2: When effective interactions among system components compress into low-dimensional interaction space, global organization is governed by geometric constraints rather than detailed dynamics. Low interaction dimensionality imposes upper bounds on number, separability, and robustness of collective organizations. Many macroscopic organizations are excluded a priori even when locally-compatible interactions exist, shifting explanation from generative mechanisms to structural impossibility.

candidates.title_1: Intelligent Control of Transportation Flow in Physarum Networks
candidates.title_2: Stability and robustness of a generalized pump-leak model for epithelial cell and lumen volume regulation
candidates.mechanism_1: Physarum network morphology responds to environmental stimuli by expanding or retracting tubes. Cytoplasmic flow bidirectionally transports nutrients through the network. Flow patterns optimize based on nutrient source locations. Network adapts topology through tube reinforcement when flow is high and tube degradation when flow is low. This creates an intelligent search for optimal transport paths through flow-structure feedback.
candidates.mechanism_2: Epithelial cells regulate volume through coordinated ion pumps, channels, and paracellular pathways. Pumps actively transport ions creating concentration gradients. Osmotic pressure drives water flow following ion movement. Cell-lumen interaction creates coupled volume dynamics. Pump rates, leak permeabilities, and osmotic coupling determine stability. Feedback between cell volume and pump activity maintains homeostasis.

candidates.title_1: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns in semiarid ecosystems
candidates.title_2: Distinguishable spreading dynamics in microbial communities
candidates.mechanism_1: Plants facilitate neighboring growth through local resource modification. Facilitation competes with resource competition. When precipitation is intermittent, facilitation-competition balance creates spatial vegetation patterns. Below threshold density, vegetation collapses due to weakened facilitation (spatial Allee effect).
candidates.mechanism_2: Proliferation limitations determine spreading dynamics. Growth arrest causes superlinear spreading at reduced rate. Pressure-limited growth produces linear constant-speed spreading. Nutrient-limited growth exhibits phase transition: superlinear when nutrient supply is high, sublinear when depleted. Nutrient supply and conversion efficiency determine phase boundary. Spreading rate distinguishes dominant limitation type.

candidates.title_1: Growth Models Under Uniform Catastrophes
candidates.title_2: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Catastrophic events trigger population dispersal strategies. Dispersion affects survival probability and extinction time. Spatial constraints modulate the effectiveness of dispersal - unconstrained dispersion improves survival while spatial limits reduce the benefit, creating a trade-off between mobility and stability.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled multi-timescale dynamics with threshold-based control transition. Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). Natural control sufficient above threshold; below threshold requires engineered intervention to navigate both timescales simultaneously.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: The near-continuum mechanism for extended Boltzmann theory: the non-equilibrium relaxation
candidates.mechanism_1: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-mode coupled non-equilibrium relaxation with cross-mode energy exchange. System tracks multiple energy pools (translational, rotational degrees of freedom) with distinct temperatures evolving through collision-mediated energy transfer. Relaxation dynamics exhibit mode coupling where heat flux interactions between pools affect global equilibration rates, creating thermal conductivity dependence on degree of inter-mode non-equilibrium.

candidates.title_2: AEGPO: Adaptive Entropy-Guided Policy Optimization for Diffusion Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Global level: relative entropy change identifies high-value samples for prioritized exploration. Local level: absolute entropy peaks identify critical moments within each trajectory. Concentrates computation where information gain is highest rather than uniform distribution.

Chemical dynamics explore high-dimensional space while populations switch intermittently.

Negative feedback prevents runaway growth maintaining stable patterns. Noise enables exploration preventing premature convergence to suboptimal states. Information-per-simulation increases by reusing structural similarities in discrete optimization landscape.
candidates.mechanism_2: Higher-order network structure (beyond pairwise) shapes imitation dynamics through group-dependent adoption rates. Information diversity achieved through structured sampling from local neighborhoods. Adoption probability depends on group composition and size, not just neighbor count. candidates.title_1: Strategic Interactions in Science and Technology Networks: Substitutes or Complements?
candidates.title_2: Division of labor enables efficient collective decision-making under uncertainty
candidates.mechanism_1: An agent's position in a collaboration network determines their productivity. Activity in one domain (scientific) enhances productivity in another domain (technological), but this effect is asymmetric - the reverse direction shows no detectable influence.
candidates.mechanism_2: Division of labor emerges from heterogeneous response thresholds combined with task-dependent positive feedback. Individuals with low thresholds specialize in corresponding tasks as they activate more frequently and self-reinforce. Threshold distribution determines whether population exhibits generalism or specialized subpopulations. Decentralized coordination through threshold heterogeneity without central control.

candidates.title_1: Learning to Share: Selective Memory for Efficient Parallel Agentic Systems
candidates.title_2: The Where and How of Touch: A Review of Tactile Localization Research
candidates.mechanism_1: Learned selective information sharing across parallel exploration processes. Multiple independent teams explore different solution trajectories with learned controller deciding which intermediate results to place in globally-accessible shared memory. Balances exploration diversity (parallel independence) against computational efficiency (reuse of overlapping sub-solutions), using stepwise credit assignment to identify globally useful information.
candidates.mechanism_2: Agent strategies co-evolve through mutual adaptation. Nash equilibrium emerges when no agent benefits from unilateral deviation. Non-stationarity from other agents' learning destabilizes convergence. Meta-learning about opponent adaptation patterns improves strategy selection. candidates.title_1: Heterogeneity dominates irreversibility in random Markov models
candidates.title_2: A generalized work theorem for stopped stochastic chemical reaction networks
candidates.mechanism_1: Markov dynamics combine heterogeneity and asymmetry (broken detailed balance). Heterogeneity parameter controls transition rate variability. Asymmetry parameter controls forward-backward correlation. Critical locus emerges where relaxation times diverge. Entropy production and predictive information depend strongly on heterogeneity but weakly on asymmetry. Near criticality, small heterogeneity changes cause large dynamical shifts.
candidates.mechanism_2: Chemical reaction networks exhibit martingale structure in generalized entropy without requiring detailed balance. Martingale properties emerge directly from reaction propensity structure: the jump process compensated with appropriate drift becomes a zero-mean stochastic process. This enables work theorems for arbitrary stopping times and singular initial conditions, generalizing thermodynamic relations beyond equilibrium systems.

candidates.title_1: Impact of seed node position on network robustness under localized attacks
candidates.title_2: Modeling tumor progression in heterogeneous microenvironments: A cellular automata approach

candidates.mechanism_2: Environmental state dominates progression dynamics over intrinsic mutation rates in spatially structured systems: supportive environments amplify weak growth signals into invasive spread, while inhibitory environments suppress even high-mutation populations.

candidates.title_1: Habitat heterogeneity and dispersal network structure as drivers of metacommunity dynamics

candidates.mechanism_2: Large-scale forcing injects energy into system. Energy cascades to smaller scales through vortex stretching. Dissipation at smallest scales balances energy input. Inertial range exhibits self-similar scaling between forcing and dissipation scales. Intermittency creates non-uniform energy transfer with localized intense events.

candidates.title_1: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence
candidates.title_2: Estimating measures of information processing during cognitive tasks using functional magnetic resonance imaging
candidates.mechanism_1: Local monomer depletion creates negative feedback between network density and growth. Epiplexity (structural information encoding) and empowerment (control capacity) provide recognition vs. control axes for physical intelligence. Landauer-scale closed-cycle benchmarks require explicit boundary-closure and reset assumptions - without charging for external low-entropy resources, information gain and dissipation decouple.
candidates.mechanism_2: Active information storage (within-region retention), transfer entropy (directed flow), and net synergy (redundancy vs. synergy) quantify information processing. Cross mutual information combines resting-state and task data to address limited samples. AIS increases with cognitive load in fronto-parietal regions; TE reveals enhanced directed flows; net synergy shows global redundancy shift.

candidates.title_1: To clean or not to clean: The free-rider problem in sequentially shared resources
candidates.title_2: Mathematical Modeling of Common-Pool Resources: A Comprehensive Review of Bioeconomics, Strategic Interaction, and Complex Adaptive Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Shared resource use creates a cooperation dilemma with cleaning costs, contamination risk, and social incentives forming competing pressures. Cleaning cost primarily determines stability of altruistic behavior. The system exhibits multi-stability and hysteresis - small parameter changes can cause abrupt shifts between cooperation and free-riding equilibria.
candidates.mechanism_2: Paradigm shift from static optimization to dynamic resilience in commons management. Early deterministic bioeconomic models established individual-collective efficiency tension. Ostrom turn integrated institutional monitoring and sanctions into game theory. Evolutionary dynamics and behavioral economics relaxed rationality. Stochastic models capture spatial heterogeneity and noise-induced regime shifts with early warning signals.

candidates.title_1: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.title_2: Emergent structures in coupled opinion and network dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: When agents fall below a resource threshold, they solicit resources from connected neighbors based on relatedness. Redistribution creates feedback between kinship network structure and reproduction ability. This enables population survival at lower resource densities but increases network heterogeneity and local centralization.
candidates.mechanism_2: Individuals' opinions and network edge weights coevolve through coupled dynamics. Interaction strength depends on opinion distance. Similar opinions strengthen network connections. Connection strength amplifies opinion influence. This creates feedback between opinion convergence and network structure formation. Interaction function form determines emergent structures and stability.

candidates.title_1: Taming multiparty entanglement at measurement-induced phase transitions
candidates.title_2: Emergence of Superintelligence from Collective Near-Critical Dynamics in Reentrant Neural Fields
candidates.mechanism_1: Quantum systems undergo measurement-induced phase transitions when unitary evolution competes with measurements. Below critical measurement rate, volume-law entanglement dominates. Above critical rate, area-law entanglement emerges. Measurement rate acts as control parameter for phase transition. Competing dynamics create distinct entanglement phases. Multiparty entanglement structure differs across phases.
candidates.mechanism_2: Qualitative phase transition via spectral condensation at criticality. Progressive reentrant coupling drives system toward infrared critical regime where extensive band of slow collective modes emerges (spectral condensation), reorganizing dynamics qualitatively. Creates emergent capabilities absent at subcritical regime - transition in kind not degree, regardless of system scale.

candidates.title_1: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns in semiarid ecosystems
candidates.title_2: Greedy Routing Reachability Games
candidates.mechanism_1: Plants facilitate neighboring growth through local resource modification. Facilitation competes with resource competition. When precipitation is intermittent, facilitation-competition balance creates spatial vegetation patterns. Below threshold density, vegetation collapses due to weakened facilitation (spatial Allee effect).
candidates.mechanism_2: Temporal niche differentiation through phenotypic plasticity in circadian rhythms enables species coexistence. Phase-locking of coupled oscillators creates temporal resource partitioning. Plasticity allows dynamic adjustment of activity timing based on competitor presence. Coexistence emerges when plastic responses generate sufficient temporal separation in resource use patterns.

candidates.title_1: Modeling tumor progression in heterogeneous microenvironments: A cellular automata approach
candidates.title_2: Decaying Sensitivity of the Zero Solution for a Class of Nonlinear Optimal Control Problems
candidates.mechanism_1: Environmental state dominates progression dynamics over intrinsic mutation rates in spatially structured systems: supportive environments amplify weak growth signals into invasive spread, while inhibitory environments suppress even high-mutation populations.
candidates.mechanism_2: Localized perturbations in graph-structured systems induce optimal trajectories that decay exponentially with graph distance from perturbation source. Graph distance acts as effective spatial dimension governing perturbation propagation, with topology imposing decay rate independently of detailed dynamics.

candidates.title_1: Markov Decision Processes of the Third Kind: Learning Distributions by Policy Gradient Descent
candidates.title_2: Dr. Kernel: Reinforcement Learning Done Right for Triton Kernel Generations
candidates.mechanism_1: Distributional MDPs steer cumulative reward distribution toward target law rather than optimizing expected value. Randomized Markov policies on augmented state space with characteristic-function loss enable distribution matching. Policy gradient converges to stationary points. Non-uniqueness phenomena emerge - multiple distinct policies can achieve same target distribution.
candidates.mechanism_2: Turn-level Reinforce-Leave-One-Out provides unbiased advantage estimation for multi-turn RL by excluding self from baseline. Prevents biased policy gradient from self-inclusion in GRPO. Profiling-based rewards and rejection sampling overcome lazy optimization where models hack training rewards prioritizing trivial correctness over meaningful optimization. Multi-turn mismatch correction ensures training stability.

candidates.title_1: Minimal-Action Discrete Schrödinger Bridge Matching for Peptide Sequence Design
candidates.title_2: Counting models with excessive zeros ensuring stochastic monotonicity

candidates.mechanism_2: Self-propelled particles accumulate where motility decreases. Density-dependent motility creates positive feedback: high density reduces motility causing further accumulation. Phase separation emerges without attractive interactions purely from activity. Noise disrupts ordering while persistence enhances clustering. Critical activity threshold separates homogeneous from phase-separated states.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic Origin of Degree-Day Scaling in Phase-Change Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Phase transitions impose topological constraints that mask energetic fluctuations. Introducing a latent temperature (counterfactual unconstrained trajectory) resolves information loss. Energy conservation enforces duality: total latent heat dissipated equals accumulated exceedance of latent temperature above melting point. This duality is mathematically equivalent to Wasserstein-1 distance (optimal transport) between latent and observed trajectories, with phase change emerging as transport that projects continuous energy variability onto constrained thermodynamic boundaries.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: Cross-feeding yields high-dimensional chaos and coexistence of species beyond exclusion principle

Higher local density and relational closeness emerge as redistribution-dependent survival creates centralized clusters through cooperative resource sharing.
candidates.mechanism_2: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.

candidates.mechanism_2: Cooperation and disease transmission coevolve through network structure. Cost heterogeneity creates weakest links - low-risk individuals free-ride and act as disease reservoirs, undermining cooperation. Heterogeneity is double-edged: influence asymmetry facilitates cooperation, motivation asymmetry degrades it.

candidates.title_1: Multi-strain SIS dynamics with coinfection under host population structure
candidates.title_2: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Multiple pathogen strains circulate and co-infect hosts with different susceptibilities and clearance rates. Host population structure creates differential transmission pathways across classes. Strain interactions through coinfection alter individual transmission dynamics. Class-specific epidemiological traits modulate strain competition and coexistence patterns.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled multi-timescale dynamics with threshold-based control transition. Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). Natural control sufficient above threshold; below threshold requires engineered intervention to navigate both timescales simultaneously.

candidates.title_1: Emergence of Superintelligence from Collective Near-Critical Dynamics in Reentrant Neural Fields
candidates.title_2: CORDS: Continuous Representations of Discrete Structures
candidates.mechanism_1: Qualitative phase transition via spectral condensation at criticality. Progressive reentrant coupling drives system toward infrared critical regime where extensive band of slow collective modes emerges (spectral condensation), reorganizing dynamics qualitatively. Creates emergent capabilities absent at subcritical regime - transition in kind not degree, regardless of system scale.
candidates.mechanism_2: Large-scale forcing injects energy into system. Energy cascades to smaller scales through vortex stretching. Dissipation at smallest scales balances energy input. Inertial range exhibits self-similar scaling between forcing and dissipation scales. Intermittency creates non-uniform energy transfer with localized intense events.

candidates.title_1: Thermodynamic Origin of Degree-Day Scaling in Phase-Change Systems
candidates.title_2: Understanding the temperature response of biological systems: Part II -- Network-level mechanisms and emergent dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Phase transitions impose topological constraints that mask energetic fluctuations. Introducing a latent temperature (counterfactual unconstrained trajectory) resolves information loss. Energy conservation enforces duality: total latent heat dissipated equals accumulated exceedance of latent temperature above melting point. This duality is mathematically equivalent to Wasserstein-1 distance (optimal transport) between latent and observed trajectories, with phase change emerging as transport that projects continuous energy variability onto constrained thermodynamic boundaries.
candidates.mechanism_2: Individual Arrhenius-like temperature dependence at reaction level transforms into non-Arrhenius scaling, thermal limits, and temperature compensation at network level. Coupled biochemical reactions with temperature-modulated kinetics exhibit emergent system-level temperature response curves that differ from component behaviors. Network coupling creates effective nonlinearities and collective constraints, transforming simple exponential dependencies into complex organism-level thermal responses.

candidates.title_1: Multiple timescales in collective motion: daily and intraday upstream fish migration focusing on Feller condition
candidates.title_2: Distinguishable spreading dynamics in microbial communities
candidates.mechanism_1: The ratio between diffusion and drift (Feller condition) determines qualitative migration properties. High diffusion relative to drift creates randomized, intermittent movement patterns. Low ratio produces more deterministic, continuous movement. This ratio acts as a control parameter governing timescale-dependent behavioral transitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Proliferation limitations determine spreading dynamics. Growth arrest causes superlinear spreading at reduced rate. Pressure-limited growth produces linear constant-speed spreading. Nutrient-limited growth exhibits phase transition: superlinear when nutrient supply is high, sublinear when depleted. Nutrient supply and conversion efficiency determine phase boundary. Spreading rate distinguishes dominant limitation type.

candidates.title_1: Markov Decision Processes of the Third Kind: Learning Distributions by Policy Gradient Descent
candidates.title_2: Equilibrium Propagation for Non-Conservative Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Distributional MDPs steer cumulative reward distribution toward target law rather than optimizing expected value. Randomized Markov policies on augmented state space with characteristic-function loss enable distribution matching. Policy gradient converges to stationary points. Non-uniqueness phenomena emerge - multiple distinct policies can achieve same target distribution.
candidates.mechanism_2: Augmented state space with corrective dynamics extends equilibrium-based learning to non-conservative systems: adding auxiliary variables and non-reciprocal correction terms to learning dynamics recovers exact gradients despite broken energy conservation.

candidates.title_1: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.title_2: Reducing the Computational Cost Scaling of Tensor Network Algorithms via Field-Programmable Gate Array Parallelism
candidates.mechanism_1: Threshold-based resource redistribution creates feedback between network structure and resource allocation ability. Agents below threshold solicit help; helpers contribute fractionally based on relatedness. Higher local density and relational closeness emerge as redistribution-dependent survival creates centralized clusters through cooperative resource sharing.
candidates.mechanism_2: Agents update opinions by averaging with similar neighbors (bounded confidence). Homophily creates echo chambers reinforcing existing beliefs. Opinion clusters emerge when confidence bound below critical threshold. Consensus possible when confidence bound exceeds opinion diversity. External influence can break polarization or accelerate consensus formation.

candidates.title_1: Cross-feeding yields high-dimensional chaos and coexistence of species beyond exclusion principle
candidates.title_2: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers
candidates.mechanism_1: Species cross-feed through metabolite leakage and uptake. Competitive uptake of leaked chemicals creates coupled population-chemical dynamics. Network structure determines attractor types: fixed points, limit cycles, low-dimensional chaos, or high-dimensional chaos. High-dimensional chaos enables coexistence beyond competitive exclusion limits through intermittent switching among quasi-stationary states. Chemical dynamics explore high-dimensional space while populations switch intermittently.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multiple branched actin networks compete for shared monomer pool. Network growth locally depletes monomers creating negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Local depletion couples network growth rates through shared resource. Under weak competition, networks coexist at steady state. Under strong competition, selection replaces coexistence - fastest-growing network excludes others. Competition strength determined by monomer availability and consumption rates.

candidates.title_1: Thermodynamic cost-controllability tradeoff in metabolic currency coupling
candidates.title_2: Understanding the temperature response of biological systems: Part II -- Network-level mechanisms and emergent dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Controllability-efficiency tradeoff in coupled resource management: independent regulation of multiple coupled resources requires balanced abundances to prevent cross-interference, but balanced states incur higher thermodynamic costs through increased entropy production.
candidates.mechanism_2: Individual Arrhenius-like temperature dependence at reaction level transforms into non-Arrhenius scaling, thermal limits, and temperature compensation at network level. Coupled biochemical reactions with temperature-modulated kinetics exhibit emergent system-level temperature response curves that differ from component behaviors. Network coupling creates effective nonlinearities and collective constraints, transforming simple exponential dependencies into complex organism-level thermal responses.

candidates.title_1: Effect of higher-order interactions on noisy majority-rule dynamics with random group sizes
candidates.title_2: A novel scalable high performance diffusion solver for multiscale cell simulations
candidates.mechanism_1: Variable group sizes in majority-rule dynamics create heterogeneous influence through effective majority leverage. Rare large-group events can realign substantial population fractions. Critical threshold for independence depends on group-size distribution - heavy-tailed distributions enhance robustness to disorder through occasional macroscopic coordination events.
candidates.mechanism_2: Agent states at micro-level aggregate to create macro-level concentration fields. Diffusion processes spread concentrations across spatial domains. Individual agents respond to local concentration values changing behavior. Agent behavioral changes modify concentration production rates. Feedback loop: micro-level behaviors → macro-level fields → micro-level responses.

candidates.title_1: Estimating measures of information processing during cognitive tasks using functional magnetic resonance imaging
candidates.title_2: Phase Transitions in Unsupervised Feature Selection
candidates.mechanism_1: Active information storage (within-region retention), transfer entropy (directed flow), and net synergy (redundancy vs. synergy) quantify information processing. Cross mutual information combines resting-state and task data to address limited samples. AIS increases with cognitive load in fronto-parietal regions; TE reveals enhanced directed flows; net synergy shows global redundancy shift.
candidates.mechanism_2: Phase transition between constrained (glass-like) and unconstrained (liquid-like) regimes identifies minimal informative feature sets: critical feature count where order-parameter distributions shift from bimodal to unimodal marks saturation of downstream task performance.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: LALM-as-a-Judge: Benchmarking Large Audio-Language Models for Safety Evaluation in Multi-Turn Spoken Dialogues
candidates.mechanism_1: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Local interaction rules between neighbors generate global collective patterns. Positive feedback amplifies small asymmetries into coherent group behavior. Negative feedback prevents runaway growth maintaining stable patterns. Noise enables exploration preventing premature convergence to suboptimal states. Emergent behavior robustness increases with redundancy in agent numbers.

candidates.title_1: Cell size control in bacteria is modulated through extrinsic noise, single-cell- and population-growth
candidates.title_2: Effect of higher-order interactions on noisy majority-rule dynamics with random group sizes
candidates.mechanism_1: Cell size fluctuates due to noisy growth rates and size-dependent division noise. Size homeostasis mechanisms compensate for fluctuations through size control strategies. Population dynamics alter size distributions compared to single lineages - exponential population growth changes the effective size control measured in constant-volume experiments. Extrinsic growth noise and population structure jointly determine observed size distributions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Variable group sizes in majority-rule dynamics create heterogeneous influence through effective majority leverage. Rare large-group events can realign substantial population fractions. Critical threshold for independence depends on group-size distribution - heavy-tailed distributions enhance robustness to disorder through occasional macroscopic coordination events.

candidates.title_1: On the occupation measure of evolution models with vanishing mutations
candidates.title_2: Counting models with excessive zeros ensuring stochastic monotonicity
candidates.mechanism_1: Collective oscillations in many-body systems mediate nonlinear wave mixing without requiring strong single-particle nonlinearity. Coherent many-body response creates effective nonlinearity through collective mode coupling. Weak individual interactions amplified by collective dynamics generate strong wave mixing. Effective interaction strength scales with system size or coupling density.
candidates.mechanism_2: Self-propelled particles accumulate where motility decreases. Density-dependent motility creates positive feedback: high density reduces motility causing further accumulation. Phase separation emerges without attractive interactions purely from activity. Noise disrupts ordering while persistence enhances clustering. Critical activity threshold separates homogeneous from phase-separated states.

candidates.title_1: Estimating measures of information processing during cognitive tasks using functional magnetic resonance imaging
candidates.title_2: AEGPO: Adaptive Entropy-Guided Policy Optimization for Diffusion Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Active information storage (within-region retention), transfer entropy (directed flow), and net synergy (redundancy vs. synergy) quantify information processing. Cross mutual information combines resting-state and task data to address limited samples. AIS increases with cognitive load in fronto-parietal regions; TE reveals enhanced directed flows; net synergy shows global redundancy shift.
candidates.mechanism_2: Dual-signal adaptive resource allocation using entropy as proxy for learning value. Global level: relative entropy change identifies high-value samples for prioritized exploration. Local level: absolute entropy peaks identify critical moments within each trajectory. Concentrates computation where information gain is highest rather than uniform distribution.

candidates.title_1: Effects of multi-phase control mechanism on fibroblast dynamics: A segmented mathematical modeling approach
candidates.title_2: A Multi-decoder Neural Tracking Method for Accurately Predicting Speech Intelligibility
candidates.mechanism_1: Cell size determined by control mechanisms across cell cycle phases (sizer, timer, adder strategies). Division kernel and phase-specific control govern size distribution. Population-density-dependent regulation limits total cell numbers (extrinsic feedback). Cell-size-dependent regulation suppresses size variability (intrinsic feedback). Trade-off between extrinsic and intrinsic control.
candidates.mechanism_2: System behavior near phase transition becomes scale-invariant. Correlation length diverges as control parameter approaches critical value. Fluctuations at all scales contribute equally near criticality. Universal exponents characterize transition independent of microscopic details. Finite-size effects modify scaling when system size comparable to correlation length.

candidates.title_1: Normative Equivalence in Human-AI Cooperation: Behaviour, Not Identity, Drives Cooperation in Mixed-Agent Groups
candidates.title_2: Pairwise is Not Enough: Hypergraph Neural Networks for Multi-Agent Pathfinding
candidates.mechanism_1: Reciprocal group dynamics and behavioral inertia drive cooperation levels in groups. Cooperation depends on observed group behavior patterns rather than the identity of participants. These normative mechanisms operate identically regardless of agent type, creating stable cooperation patterns through behavioral feedback.
candidates.mechanism_2: Hypergraph attention captures group (beyond pairwise) coordination dynamics in multi-agent pathfinding. Standard GNNs limited to pairwise message passing suffer attention dilution in dense environments where group coordination is critical. Attentional mechanisms over directed hypergraphs explicitly model higher-order interactions, mitigating representational bottleneck and enabling complex coordination where pairwise methods fail.

candidates.title_1: Technology Adoption and Network Externalities in Financial Systems: A Spatial-Network Approach
candidates.title_2: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers
candidates.mechanism_1: Technology adoption spreads through spatial and network channels. Spatial spillovers and network externalities interact multiplicatively - nearby adoption and connected peer adoption amplify each other. Cumulative adoption pressure accumulates along stochastic paths through spatial-network space. Network position amplifies or dampens spatial effects, creating non-linear adoption dynamics.
candidates.mechanism_2: Local monomer depletion from network growth creates negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Higher density causes faster monomer consumption and slower growth. Multiple networks sharing finite monomer pool reach steady states through self-regulation. Under strong competition, coexistence transitions to selection.

candidates.title_1: The Architecture of Illusion: Network Opacity and Strategic Escalation
candidates.title_2: Higher-order adaptive behaviors outperform pairwise strategies in mitigating contagion dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Network-mediated observation bias creates systematic misperception in strategic reasoning. Agents observe only network-local sample biased by position (algorithmic ranking, homophily), not global population. Locality parameter controls observation bias magnitude, creating distorted beliefs about opponent sophistication that drive strategic escalation beyond what accurate global information would produce.
candidates.mechanism_2: Higher-order information creates heterogeneous risk perception targeting structural hubs and high-participation nodes, preventing contagion exploitation of these critical paths at lower social cost than uniform interventions.

candidates.title_1: Compressing Complexity: A Critical Synthesis of Structural, Analytical, and Data-Driven Dimensionality Reduction in Dynamical Networks
candidates.title_2: Non-Stationary Inventory Control with Lead Times
candidates.mechanism_1: Three reduction paradigms form Pareto frontier between computational tractability and physical fidelity: structural coarse-graining (spectral/topological contraction), analytical reduction (moment closures preserving mechanisms), and data-driven reduction (manifold learning prioritizing prediction). Selection governed by no-free-lunch theorem - epistemological trade-off between causal mechanism preservation versus predictive power.
candidates.mechanism_2: Systems with delayed feedback combined with censored observations face fundamental learning limitations compared to systems with immediate uncensored feedback, creating a sharp performance separation even with identical optimization algorithms.

candidates.title_1: Thermodynamic cost-controllability tradeoff in metabolic currency coupling
candidates.title_2: A generalized work theorem for stopped stochastic chemical reaction networks
candidates.mechanism_1: Controllability-efficiency tradeoff in coupled resource management: independent regulation of multiple coupled resources requires balanced abundances to prevent cross-interference, but balanced states incur higher thermodynamic costs through increased entropy production.
candidates.mechanism_2: Chemical reaction networks exhibit martingale structure in generalized entropy without requiring detailed balance. Martingale properties emerge directly from reaction propensity structure: the jump process compensated with appropriate drift becomes a zero-mean stochastic process. This enables work theorems for arbitrary stopping times and singular initial conditions, generalizing thermodynamic relations beyond equilibrium systems.

candidates.title_1: DeXposure-FM: A Time-series, Graph Foundation Model for Credit Exposures and Stability on Decentralized Financial Networks
candidates.title_2: The impact of heterogeneity on the co-evolution of cooperation and epidemic spreading in complex networks
candidates.mechanism_1: Token-mediated dependencies create dense inter-component connections. A shock to one component propagates through dependency links causing contagion effects. Network topology and link weights determine the extent and path of cascading failures across the system.
candidates.mechanism_2: Cooperation and disease transmission coevolve through network structure. Structural heterogeneity creates leverage points - highly connected hubs adopt protection due to amplified risk, catalyzing cooperation. Cost heterogeneity creates weakest links - low-risk individuals free-ride and act as disease reservoirs, undermining cooperation. Heterogeneity is double-edged: influence asymmetry facilitates cooperation, motivation asymmetry degrades it.

candidates.title_1: From Discrete to Continuous Mixed Populations of Conformists, Nonconformists, and Imitators
candidates.title_2: Full-Covariance Chemical Langevin Predator--Prey Diffusion with Absorbing Boundaries
candidates.mechanism_1: Three behavioral types interact: conformists benefit from choosing common strategies, nonconformists profit from rare strategies, and imitators copy highest earners. Population proportions fluctuate in finite populations but equilibrate as population size increases. Strategy proportions undergo perpetual oscillations in small populations, but fluctuation amplitudes approach zero in large populations through stochastic averaging.
candidates.mechanism_2: Predation creates event-level coupling through biomass conversion: predation-conversion increment (-1,+1) induces strictly negative cross-covariance between prey and predator populations. This mechanistic coupling cannot be captured by diagonal (independent) noise. The coupled dynamics arise from the irreducible stochastic structure of predation events, where prey loss simultaneously causes predator gain, creating intrinsic negative correlation in population fluctuations.

candidates.title_1: AEGPO: Adaptive Entropy-Guided Policy Optimization for Diffusion Models
candidates.title_2: Piecewise Deterministic Markov Processes for Bayesian Inference of PDE Coefficients
candidates.mechanism_1: Dual-signal adaptive resource allocation using entropy as proxy for learning value. Global level: relative entropy change identifies high-value samples for prioritized exploration. Local level: absolute entropy peaks identify critical moments within each trajectory. Concentrates computation where information gain is highest rather than uniform distribution.
candidates.mechanism_2: Surrogate-assisted proposal generation with dynamic correction bounds enables efficient exploration when exact evaluations are expensive: surrogate provides cheap proposals, dynamic offset enforcement maintains correctness.

candidates.title_1: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution
candidates.title_2: PhysicsAgentABM: Physics-Guided Generative Agent-Based Modeling
candidates.mechanism_1: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Two-layer adaptation - individual learning plus population-level evolution - determines whether strategies persist, collapse, or form coalitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Population-level inference with uncertainty-aware fusion decouples global dynamics from individual variability: clustering behaviorally similar entities, encoding mechanistic priors, and fusing uncertain predictions at cluster level enables scalable simulation.

candidates.title_1: Impact of behavioral heterogeneity on epidemic outcome and its mapping into effective network topologies
candidates.title_2: Transit-time oscillations in nanoscale vacuum diode with a pure resistive load
candidates.mechanism_1: Behavioral heterogeneity with homophily creates resurgence dynamics near critical thresholds: diverse risk responses combined with preferential interaction among similar types produces initial decline followed by secondary surge as low-risk subpopulation becomes infected.
candidates.mechanism_2: Population diversity prevents premature convergence to local optima. Selection pressure drives convergence reducing diversity over time. Niching mechanisms maintain subpopulations exploring different regions. Pareto dominance creates trade-off frontier between competing objectives. Archive strategies preserve non-dominated solutions preventing diversity loss.

candidates.title_1: Technology Adoption and Network Externalities in Financial Systems: A Spatial-Network Approach
candidates.title_2: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.mechanism_1: Technology adoption spreads through spatial and network channels. Spatial spillovers and network externalities interact multiplicatively - nearby adoption and connected peer adoption amplify each other. Cumulative adoption pressure accumulates along stochastic paths through spatial-network space. Network position amplifies or dampens spatial effects, creating non-linear adoption dynamics.
candidates.mechanism_2: Threshold-based resource redistribution creates feedback between network structure and resource allocation ability. Agents below threshold solicit help; helpers contribute fractionally based on relatedness. Higher local density and relational closeness emerge as redistribution-dependent survival creates centralized clusters through cooperative resource sharing.

candidates.title_1: Greedy Routing Reachability Games
candidates.title_2: An attention economy model of co-evolution between content quality and audience selectivity
candidates.mechanism_1: Temporal niche differentiation through phenotypic plasticity in circadian rhythms enables species coexistence. Phase-locking of coupled oscillators creates temporal resource partitioning. Plasticity allows dynamic adjustment of activity timing based on competitor presence. Coexistence emerges when plastic responses generate sufficient temporal separation in resource use patterns.
candidates.mechanism_2: Seed dormancy as bet-hedging strategy in temporally fluctuating environments. Germination fraction trades off current reproduction against future survival through dormant seed bank. Optimal dormancy level depends on environmental variability - higher variance favors increased dormancy. Multi-year averaging through seed bank buffers against temporal unpredictability.

candidates.title_1: Impact of seed node position on network robustness under localized attacks
candidates.title_2: Plasticity, hysteresis, and recovery mechanisms in spider silk fibers
candidates.mechanism_1: Localized damage initiates at a seed node and propagates to neighbors. The structural position of the seed node (local connectivity and topology) amplifies or dampens damage progression. Cumulative link severing during attack progression depends critically on seed node characteristics rather than average network properties.
candidates.mechanism_2: Parallel networks with distinct failure modes enable large reversible deformations: brittle bond network governs initial stiffness and yield point, entropic elastic network enables large deformations post-yield; reorganization and rebonding during recovery locks new equilibrium with increased stiffness.

candidates.title_1: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns in semiarid ecosystems
candidates.title_2: Mathematical Modeling of Common-Pool Resources: A Comprehensive Review of Bioeconomics, Strategic Interaction, and Complex Adaptive Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Intermittent resource pulses interact with positive density dependence (Allee effects) to generate irregular spatial clusters. During favorable pulses, local facilitation enables patch expansion; during scarcity, neighborhood density determines survival. Resilience emerges from spatial covariance and local density rather than total biomass.
candidates.mechanism_2: Paradigm shift from static optimization to dynamic resilience in commons management. Early deterministic bioeconomic models established individual-collective efficiency tension. Ostrom turn integrated institutional monitoring and sanctions into game theory. Evolutionary dynamics and behavioral economics relaxed rationality. Stochastic models capture spatial heterogeneity and noise-induced regime shifts with early warning signals.

candidates.title_1: Taming multiparty entanglement at measurement-induced phase transitions
candidates.title_2: Heterogeneity dominates irreversibility in random Markov models
candidates.mechanism_1: Quantum systems undergo measurement-induced phase transitions when unitary evolution competes with measurements. Below critical measurement rate, volume-law entanglement dominates. Above critical rate, area-law entanglement emerges. Measurement rate acts as control parameter for phase transition. Competing dynamics create distinct entanglement phases. Multiparty entanglement structure differs across phases.
candidates.mechanism_2: Markov dynamics combine heterogeneity and asymmetry (broken detailed balance). Heterogeneity parameter controls transition rate variability. Asymmetry parameter controls forward-backward correlation. Critical locus emerges where relaxation times diverge. Entropy production and predictive information depend strongly on heterogeneity but weakly on asymmetry. Near criticality, small heterogeneity changes cause large dynamical shifts.

candidates.title_1: Discrete dynamical systems with scaling and inversion symmetries
candidates.title_2: Counting models with excessive zeros ensuring stochastic monotonicity
candidates.mechanism_1: System state evolves discretely through iterated function. Scaling symmetry preserves dynamics under magnification/contraction. Near fixed points, small perturbations grow exponentially (positive Lyapunov exponent) causing sensitive dependence. Trajectories confined to fractal attractor with non-integer dimension. Chaotic regime characterized by scaling laws and self-similarity across scales.
candidates.mechanism_2: Self-propelled particles accumulate where motility decreases. Density-dependent motility creates positive feedback: high density reduces motility causing further accumulation. Phase separation emerges without attractive interactions purely from activity. Noise disrupts ordering while persistence enhances clustering. Critical activity threshold separates homogeneous from phase-separated states.

candidates.title_1: Technology Adoption and Network Externalities in Financial Systems: A Spatial-Network Approach
candidates.title_2: Advancing Opinion Dynamics Modeling with Neural Diffusion-Convection-Reaction Equation
candidates.mechanism_1: Technology adoption spreads through spatial and network channels. Spatial spillovers and network externalities interact multiplicatively - nearby adoption and connected peer adoption amplify each other. Cumulative adoption pressure accumulates along stochastic paths through spatial-network space. Network position amplifies or dampens spatial effects, creating non-linear adoption dynamics.
candidates.mechanism_2: Opinion evolution emerges from three coupled processes: diffusion (local influence spreading), convection (directional opinion flow driven by global trends), and reaction (endogenous opinion change). Each level operates at distinct scales—local peer-to-peer, global population-wide, and individual internal—that interact through multi-scale coupling. The system exhibits dynamics from interacting particle theory projected onto opinion space.

candidates.title_1: Impact of seed node position on network robustness under localized attacks
candidates.title_2: Controlling extreme events in neuronal networks: A single driving signal approach
candidates.mechanism_1: Localized damage initiates at a seed node and propagates to neighbors. The structural position of the seed node (local connectivity and topology) amplifies or dampens damage progression. Cumulative link severing during attack progression depends critically on seed node characteristics rather than average network properties.
candidates.mechanism_2: Single driving signal targeting one network node suppresses extreme events network-wide through dominance mechanism. Suppression occurs via frequency decoupling - driven neuron breaks from collective proto-event frequency dynamics, disrupting synchronized extreme event generation. Larger driven subpopulation enables earlier control onset, showing scaling advantage.

candidates.title_1: Compressing Complexity: A Critical Synthesis of Structural, Analytical, and Data-Driven Dimensionality Reduction in Dynamical Networks
candidates.title_2: All-Atom GPCR-Ligand Simulation via Residual Isometric Latent Flow
candidates.mechanism_1: Three reduction paradigms form Pareto frontier between computational tractability and physical fidelity: structural coarse-graining (spectral/topological contraction), analytical reduction (moment closures preserving mechanisms), and data-driven reduction (manifold learning prioritizing prediction). Selection governed by no-free-lunch theorem - epistemological trade-off between causal mechanism preservation versus predictive power.
candidates.mechanism_2: Residual dynamics modeling via decoupling static topology from temporal fluctuations. System learns isometric latent representation preserving geometric constraints (static topology), then models temporal evolution via relative displacements anchored to initial structure rather than absolute coordinates. Separates invariant structural relationships from dynamic conformational changes, improving computational efficiency while maintaining physical fidelity.

candidates.title_1: Unveiling Scaling Behaviors in Molecular Language Models: Effects of Model Size, Data, and Representation
candidates.title_2: The local void model for the Hubble and BAO tensions
candidates.mechanism_1: Scaling behavior depends jointly on model capacity, training data volume, and input representation structure: different representations yield different scaling exponents, making representation choice as critical as model size for performance.
candidates.mechanism_2: Compression reduces data size by removing redundancy. Information loss (distortion) increases with compression ratio. Rate-distortion function defines optimal trade-off boundary. Perceptual metrics weight distortion by human sensitivity patterns. Adaptive quantization allocates bits based on local information content.

candidates.title_1: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models

candidates.mechanism_2: Self-amplifying coupling to periodic components of stochastic forcing drives phase transition from unstructured to structured behavior: weak periodic signals in noise become amplified through positive feedback, spontaneously synchronizing system components.

candidates.title_1: Indirect Reciprocity with Environmental Feedback
candidates.title_2: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution
candidates.mechanism_1: Individual behaviors shape reputation through social norms while simultaneously affecting collective resource levels. Environmental changes alter payoff structures, creating feedback between strategic behavior and resource dynamics. Reputation-based cooperation interacts with ecological constraints - cooperative behaviors deplete or enhance shared resources, which then reshape the incentives for future cooperation.
candidates.mechanism_2: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Two-layer adaptation - individual learning plus population-level evolution - determines whether strategies persist, collapse, or form coalitions.

candidates.title_1: Thermodynamic cost-controllability tradeoff in metabolic currency coupling
candidates.title_2: On the Uncertainty of Large Language Model-Based Multi-Agent Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Controllability-efficiency tradeoff in coupled resource management: independent regulation of multiple coupled resources requires balanced abundances to prevent cross-interference, but balanced states incur higher thermodynamic costs through increased entropy production.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-agent performance is governed by certainty preference: reducing entropy at any stage for any agent is critical for correct solutions. Uncertainty dynamics are largely determined in the first interaction round, establishing baseline entropy that constrains subsequent evolution. Lower base model entropy during initial problem-solving directly benefits multi-agent outcomes, suggesting initial uncertainty sets persistent constraints on collaborative effectiveness.

candidates.title_1: Emergent structures in coupled opinion and network dynamics
candidates.title_2: Crossing the Functional Desert: Cascade-Driven Assembly and Feasibility Transitions in Early Life
candidates.mechanism_1: Individuals' opinions and network edge weights coevolve through coupled dynamics. Interaction strength depends on opinion distance. Similar opinions strengthen network connections. Connection strength amplifies opinion influence. This creates feedback between opinion convergence and network structure formation. Interaction function form determines emergent structures and stability.
candidates.mechanism_2: Functional organization transitions at critical connectivity: below threshold, cascades die locally creating a functional desert (sparse, transient responses); near percolation threshold, system-spanning cascades emerge enabling discriminative responses. Connectivity-driven transition introduces coherence timescales and weak path-dependence into otherwise memoryless exploration. Network dynamics alone soften combinatorial feasibility barriers without requiring specific biochemistry.

candidates.title_1: AgentArk: Distilling Multi-Agent Intelligence into a Single LLM Agent
candidates.title_2: The Where and How of Touch: A Review of Tactile Localization Research
candidates.mechanism_1: Multi-agent iterative debate dynamics distilled into single model weights transforms explicit test-time interactions into implicit capabilities. Hierarchical distillation strategies shift computational burden from inference to training. Distilled models preserve multi-agent reasoning and self-correction while maintaining single-agent efficiency and demonstrating enhanced robustness across tasks.
candidates.mechanism_2: Agent strategies co-evolve through mutual adaptation. Nash equilibrium emerges when no agent benefits from unilateral deviation. Non-stationarity from other agents' learning destabilizes convergence. Meta-learning about opponent adaptation patterns improves strategy selection. Trade-off: exploitation of current knowledge versus exploration for opponent modeling.

candidates.title_1: Habitat heterogeneity and dispersal network structure as drivers of metacommunity dynamics
candidates.title_2: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Spatial structure and dispersal networks jointly determine species persistence. Heterogeneous habitats support stable coexistence only above a critical heterogeneity threshold. Homogeneous environments allow coexistence only in a fine-tuned marginal state, creating instability. Network topology encodes dispersal effectiveness through an effective kernel.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled multi-timescale dynamics with threshold-based control transition. Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). Natural control sufficient above threshold; below threshold requires engineered intervention to navigate both timescales simultaneously.

candidates.title_1: Habitat heterogeneity and dispersal network structure as drivers of metacommunity dynamics
candidates.title_2: Counting models with excessive zeros ensuring stochastic monotonicity
candidates.mechanism_1: Effective dispersal kernel encodes both microscopic dynamical parameters and network topology in coarse-grained metacommunity model. Metapopulation capacity generalizes to non-uniform local extinction rates. Stochasticity from finite carrying capacities yields reduced one-dimensional description with universal finite-size scaling laws for extinction times. Homogeneous environments require fine-tuned marginally stable coexistence to avoid monodominance.
candidates.mechanism_2: Self-propelled particles accumulate where motility decreases. Density-dependent motility creates positive feedback: high density reduces motility causing further accumulation. Phase separation emerges without attractive interactions purely from activity. Noise disrupts ordering while persistence enhances clustering. Critical activity threshold separates homogeneous from phase-separated states.

candidates.title_1: Markov Decision Processes of the Third Kind: Learning Distributions by Policy Gradient Descent
candidates.title_2: TKG-Thinker: Towards Dynamic Reasoning over Temporal Knowledge Graphs via Agentic Reinforcement Learning
candidates.mechanism_1: Distributional MDPs steer cumulative reward distribution toward target law rather than optimizing expected value. Randomized Markov policies on augmented state space with characteristic-function loss enable distribution matching. Policy gradient converges to stationary points. Non-uniqueness phenomena emerge - multiple distinct policies can achieve same target distribution.
candidates.mechanism_2: Dual-stage learning: supervised bootstrapping followed by reinforcement-based policy refinement. First stage (supervised fine-tuning) instills core planning capabilities via demonstration data (chain-of-thought). Second stage (reinforcement learning) refines decision policies through dynamic environment interaction using multi-dimensional rewards, enabling autonomous adaptation to complex temporal constraints beyond static supervision coverage.

candidates.title_1: OdysseyArena: Benchmarking Large Language Models For Long-Horizon, Active and Inductive Interactions
candidates.title_2: GenAI-Net: A Generative AI Framework for Automated Biomolecular Network Design
candidates.mechanism_1: Inductive rule discovery from interaction experience vs deductive execution from explicit rules. Agent must autonomously infer latent transition dynamics through long-horizon active exploration rather than following pre-specified environmental laws. Requires building internal model of state evolution from observed trajectories, enabling strategic foresight and coherent planning over extended interaction sequences.
candidates.mechanism_2: Biomolecular network design reverses the typical simulation workflow: instead of checking proposed networks, an agent proposes reactions guided by behavioral specification. Coupling generative proposal with simulation-based evaluation (user-specified objective) produces topologically diverse solutions. The generative component explores reaction space, while simulation evaluates functional fit, enabling automated discovery of networks implementing desired dynamics from specifications.

candidates.title_1: Analytical and numerical study of a parametrically excited 2DOF oscillator with nonlinear restoring magnetic force and rotating rectangular rod
candidates.title_2: Photonic neuromorphic processing with coupled spiking silicon microrings
candidates.mechanism_1: Time-periodic stiffness variation induces parametric excitation in coupled components. Nonlinear restoring forces and friction interact to produce a spectrum of dynamic responses including periodic, quasi-periodic, and chaotic behaviors. System parameters (stiffness degree, mass symmetry, friction) determine stability boundaries and response amplitude.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled microring resonators exhibit nonlinear optical dynamics with internal feedback. Injection power and wavelength control dynamical regimes: analogue, spiking, or bistable responses. Nonlinearities create sharp transitions in dynamical complexity at regime boundaries. Spiking dynamics generate sparse activity patterns. Thermal bistabilities emerge at low power enhancing computational capacity. Power-wavelength phase space determines accessible dynamical states.

candidates.title_1: An Adaptive Differentially Private Federated Learning Framework with Bi-level Optimization
candidates.title_2: GP-DHT: A Dual-Head Transformer with Contras-tive Learning for Predicting Gene Regulatory Rela-tionships across Species from Single-Cell Data
candidates.mechanism_1: Local compressed module regularizes representations to constrain gradient variability, mitigating noise amplification in heterogeneous federated learning. Adaptive gradient clipping dynamically adjusts thresholds based on historical statistics to avoid over-clipping. Constraint-aware aggregation suppresses unreliable noise-dominated updates, stabilizing global optimization under differential privacy.
candidates.mechanism_2: Dual-scope representation learning with contrastive regularization under distribution shift. System captures both local pairwise regulatory logic and global cross-context expression patterns via dual-head architecture. Contrastive learning enforces structural constraints in representation space, providing robustness against noise, sparsity, and cross-domain distributional shifts beyond what supervised signal alone provides.

candidates.title_1: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns in semiarid ecosystems
candidates.title_2: Controlling extreme events in neuronal networks: A single driving signal approach
candidates.mechanism_1: Intermittent resource pulses interact with positive density dependence (Allee effects) to generate irregular spatial clusters. During favorable pulses, local facilitation enables patch expansion; during scarcity, neighborhood density determines survival. Resilience emerges from spatial covariance and local density rather than total biomass.
candidates.mechanism_2: Single driving signal targeting one network node suppresses extreme events network-wide through dominance mechanism. Suppression occurs via frequency decoupling - driven neuron breaks from collective proto-event frequency dynamics, disrupting synchronized extreme event generation. Larger driven subpopulation enables earlier control onset, showing scaling advantage.

candidates.title_1: Discrete dynamical systems with scaling and inversion symmetries
candidates.title_2: Multiple timescales in collective motion: daily and intraday upstream fish migration focusing on Feller condition
candidates.mechanism_1: System state evolves discretely through iterated function. Scaling symmetry preserves dynamics under magnification/contraction. Near fixed points, small perturbations grow exponentially (positive Lyapunov exponent) causing sensitive dependence. Trajectories confined to fractal attractor with non-integer dimension. Chaotic regime characterized by scaling laws and self-similarity across scales.
candidates.mechanism_2: The ratio between diffusion and drift (Feller condition) determines qualitative migration properties. High diffusion relative to drift creates randomized, intermittent movement patterns. Low ratio produces more deterministic, continuous movement. This ratio acts as a control parameter governing timescale-dependent behavioral transitions.

candidates.title_1: Piecewise Deterministic Markov Processes for Bayesian Inference of PDE Coefficients
candidates.title_2: Landscape-aware Automated Algorithm Design: An Efficient Framework for Real-world Optimization
candidates.mechanism_1: Surrogate-assisted proposal generation with dynamic correction bounds enables efficient exploration when exact evaluations are expensive: surrogate provides cheap proposals, dynamic offset enforcement maintains correctness.
candidates.mechanism_2: Landscape-similarity proxies decouple algorithm discovery from expensive target evaluation: generating cheap proxy problems matching target's landscape characteristics enables extensive algorithm search before costly validation.

Noise regulates density and prevents singular concentration through equilibrium states from constrained energy minimization. Stable energy minimizers emerge from interplay between potential-driven interactions and environmental variability.
candidates.mechanism_2: Neural networks self-organize to critical state between order and chaos. At criticality, perturbations trigger avalanches with power-law size distribution. Critical state maximizes dynamic range and information transmission. Homeostatic mechanisms tune excitation-inhibition balance maintaining criticality. Deviation from criticality reduces computational capacity.

candidates.title_1: AEGPO: Adaptive Entropy-Guided Policy Optimization for Diffusion Models
candidates.title_2: The Where and How of Touch: A Review of Tactile Localization Research

candidates.mechanism_2: Agent strategies co-evolve through mutual adaptation. Nash equilibrium emerges when no agent benefits from unilateral deviation. Non-stationarity from other agents' learning destabilizes convergence. Meta-learning about opponent adaptation patterns improves strategy selection. candidates.title_1: Structure-aware imitation dynamics on higher-order networks
candidates.title_2: Decaying Sensitivity of the Zero Solution for a Class of Nonlinear Optimal Control Problems
candidates.mechanism_1: Higher-order network structure (beyond pairwise) shapes imitation dynamics through group-dependent adoption rates. Information diversity achieved through structured sampling from local neighborhoods. Adoption probability depends on group composition and size, not just neighbor count. Network hypergraph structure determines equilibrium strategy distributions through sampling bias.
candidates.mechanism_2: Localized perturbations in graph-structured systems induce optimal trajectories that decay exponentially with graph distance from perturbation source. Spatial decay arises from interaction topology: influences propagate through network edges but attenuate geometrically with path length. Graph distance acts as effective spatial dimension governing perturbation propagation, with topology imposing decay rate independently of detailed dynamics.

candidates.title_1: A Minimal Task Reveals Emergent Path Integration and Object-Location Binding in a Predictive Sequence Model
candidates.title_2: Neural Ordinary Differential Equations for Simulating Metabolic Pathway Dynamics from Time-Series Multiomics Data

Prediction accuracy improves across sequence through in-context learning. Structured representations with flexible binding emerge to support prediction - new bindings learnable late in sequence, out-of-distribution bindings acquirable through sequential exposure.
candidates.mechanism_2: Proteome-metabolome dynamics are modeled as continuous interplay via Neural ODEs. Rather than requiring pre-specified mechanistic knowledge, NODEs infer latent interaction structure directly from time-series multiomics data. Learned continuous dynamics enable simulation of temporal trajectories and anticipation of intervention effects, capturing complex feedback between protein expression and metabolite concentrations without manually encoding pathway topology.

candidates.title_2: Learning to Share: Selective Memory for Efficient Parallel Agentic Systems
